name: Dough Art
description:
Shaping childhood is an exciting adventure with Luxor Dough Art. This creative tool transforms playful imagination into tangible, artistic expressions. Easy to use and reusable, it fosters learning in shapes, sizes, and motor skills development. Get ready to unleash your creativity! 

Instructions:

If the dough becomes hard after use, simply add a few drops of water to restore its softness.
For an extended product life, store the dough in an airtight container after use.
Keep the dough in a cool and dry place, away from direct sunlight.

Caution:

Please note that this product is not for consumption.
After playing with the dough, remember to wash your hands thoroughly.
icon:
Non Toxic 
Safe for Children
did_you_know: Molded shapes can help children understand various concepts, from basic geometry to motor skills, contributing to their educational development.

name: Corrector Correction Pen
description:
The Luxor Corrector Correction Pen is the solution to your mistakes, whether in typing, handwriting, or photocopying. Its quick-drying fluid forms a solid film that effectively conceals errors, allowing you to write over them.

INSTRUCTION
Shake well before use
Squeeze tube, press tip on paper
Recap after use
Keep the tip up

CAUTION
Inflammable, keep away from open flame
Harmful if swallowed or inhaled
Keep out of reach of children
icon:
Quick-Drying Formula
Shake-to-activate mechanism
did_you_know: The first correction fluid was invented in the 1950s by a typist and single mother, Bette Nesmith Graham? Her innovation, inspired by her need to correct typing mistakes, laid the foundation for modern correction pens, revolutionizing the way we fix errors in writing.

name: Studymate Geometry Box
description: The Studymate Geometry Box is your gateway to precision. It features an innovative self-centering compass and divider for maximum accuracy and ease of use. The ruler, protractor, and set squares come with specially tapered edges, ensuring they lie flat on paper with perfect calibration for accuracy. Plus, the sharpener is equipped with a scientifically angled blade for perfect sharpening without breakage.

did_you_know: The smallest geometric shape is a point with no length, width, or height. However, it is used as the foundation for all other shapes.

did_you_know: The Post-It Note, a desk staple, was invented by accident. In 1968, while striving to create a super-strong adhesive, Spencer Silver accidentally developed a weak adhesive with no residue. It wasn't until three years later that his colleague Arthur Frye ingeniously used it as repositionable notes, giving birth to the first Post-It.
